title: I bought and own the book. Do I also own the copyright? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: No. That you be a ridiculous assumption, as how would it be enforced if everyone who bought the book claimed copyright ownership? Copyright is based on protecting the creators not the consumers. Consumers have their own rights, which doesn’t cover owning any part of the material used in a book, but simply the “copy” of the original book. Copyright is an inherent law that occurs when a creative creates something. This can only be transferred by written contractual agreement.

No…copyright is the protection that the AUTHOR of the book gets for creating the work. The buyer of the book does not get any rights other than owning a copy of the book. If you write a story and decide to publish it then your would be the copyright owner and you might sell it for “one time use” or you might sell it for “limited use” such as for a website to publish just one chapter. Copyright can get very complicated, so be careful. Good luck.
